post_title: I found two old newspapers in my room

comments.author: _modified_bear
comments.body: I have both. I think the second one is worth something to these days. Not too much, but something.

comments.author: rintinpin17
comments.body: You're missing the one after the Coppa Italia win

comments.author: diegodanovo
comments.body: tear out the first page, buy a frame and make a picture out of it!

comments.author: mangowhymango
comments.body: I liked Steven, but Moratti was bleeding black and blue for real

comments.author: vik1980
comments.body:
[**Here's**](https://telegrafi.com/en/moratti-kam-pritur-fjale-me-te-keqija-nga-tifozet/) an **old** article, from when the ultras criticized him. He said, "It was intelligent & justified. If it had been me, I'd have written worse."

Class act through & through. 

Fun Fact : One of the questions/ criticism was why the players think of him like a father (then leave the club to win elsewhere). Ronaldo, Adri, Recoba, JZ4 etc. all *loved* him.

comments.author: mangowhymango
comments.body: The scudetto one is from 2007, not from Triplete season

comments.author: Capable-Dragonfly-96
comments.body: Its not even a comparison mate

comments.author: blasphemics
comments.body: Moratti straight up kept pulling cash out of his pocket to strengthen the club. He put his life's work into our colors. A legend!

comments.author: blasphemics
comments.body:
Nobody thinks he was good with his investments. They were all over the place, very often on absurd whims. And as much love and passion he injected into the team, he was also a heavy enabler. And all players but a very few get attached to the colors as he is. A career is a career. He gave too much. 

Either way. He's a legend. And so is Bedy tbh. ðŸ™Œ

comments.author: rintinpin17
comments.body: Ah, my bad!! I didn't recognise it at first, indeed... but I thought it was just bad memory
